labels.Name: Shield Security
labels.Description: Ultimate WP Security Protection - Scans, 2FA, Firewall, SPAM, Activity Log, Security Admin, and so much more.
labels.Title: Shield Security
labels.Author: Shield Security

admin_access_restriction.name: Security Admin
admin_access_restriction.tagline: Security admin allows you to restrict access to the security plugin itself.

audit_trail.name: Activity Log
audit_trail.tagline: Track All Site Activity: Who, What, When and Where

autoupdates.name: Auto Updates
autoupdates.tagline: Take back full control of WordPress automatic updates

comments_filter.name: SPAM
comments_filter.tagline: Block comment SPAM while retaining your privacy

firewall.name: Firewall
firewall.tagline: Automatically block malicious HTTP requests and data sent to your site

hack_protect.name: Scanners
hack_protect.tagline: Automatically detect & repair vulnerable and suspicious files, plugins and themes.

ips.name: Bot/IP Blocking
ips.tagline: Detect malicious bots and visitors, and block them from accessing the site.

license.name: Pro Security
license.tagline: The Best In WordPress Security, Only Better.

lockdown.name: Lockdown
lockdown.tagline: Lockdown access to some built-in features of a WordPress site.

login_protect.name: Login Protection
login_protect.tagline: Add protections to your WordPress login forms and protect user accounts with 2-Factor Authentication.

plugin.name: General
plugin.tagline: General plugin settings that apply across the entire plugin operation.

traffic.name: Traffic
traffic.tagline: Track and monitor all HTTP requests to the site.

user_management.name: Users
user_management.tagline: Control user sessions, duration, timeouts and account sharing.

sections.title: Security Admin Restriction Settings
summary: Purpose - Restrict access using a simple Access PIN.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Security Admin Restriction Zones
summary: Purpose - Restricts access to key WordPress areas for all users not authenticated with the Security Admin Access system.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Shield White Label
summary: Purpose - Rename and re-brand the Shield Security plugin for your client site installations.

sections.title: Enable Module: WordPress Security Admin
summary: Purpose - Restricts access to this plugin preventing unauthorized changes to your security settings.
Recommendation - Keep the Security Admin feature turned on.
You need to also enter a new Access PIN to enable this feature.

sections.title: Log To DB
summary: Purpose - Provides finer control over the Activity Log itself.
Recommendation - These settings are dependent on your requirements.

sections.title: Log To File
summary: Purpose - Provides finer control over the Activity Log itself.
Recommendation - These settings are dependent on your requirements.

sections.title: Enable Module: Activity Log
summary: Purpose - The Activity Log is designed so you can look back on events and analyse what happened and what may have gone wrong.
Recommendation - Keep the Activity Log feature turned on.

sections.title: Automatic Updates For WordPress Components
summary: Purpose - Control how automatic updates for each WordPress component is handled.
Recommendation - You should at least allow minor updates for the WordPress core.

sections.title: Auto-Update Options
sections.summary: Purpose - Make adjustments to how automatic updates are handled on your site.

sections.title: Enable Module: Automatic Updates
summary: Purpose - Automatic Updates lets you manage the WordPress automatic updates engine so you choose what exactly gets updated automatically.
Recommendation - Keep the Automatic Updates feature turned on.

sections.title: Automatic Bot Comment SPAM Protection Filter
summary: Purpose - Blocks 100% of all automated bot-generated comment SPAM.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Human Comment SPAM Protection
summary: Purpose - Uses a 3rd party SPAM dictionary to detect human-based comment SPAM.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.This tool, unlike other SPAM tools such as Akismet, will not send your comment data to 3rd party services for analysis.

sections.title: Common Settings For All SPAM Scanning
summary: Purpose - Settings that apply to all comment SPAM scanning.

sections.title: Enable Module: Comments SPAM Protection
summary: Purpose - The Comments Filter can block 100% of automated spam bots and also offer the option to analyse human-generated spam.
Recommendation - Keep the Comments Filter feature turned on.

sections.title: Firewall Blocking Options
summary: Here you choose what kind of malicious data to scan for.
Recommendation - Turn on as many options here as you can. If you find an incompatibility or something stops working, un-check 1 option at a time until you find the problem or review the Activity Log.

sections.title: Choose Firewall Block Response
summary: Here you choose how the plugin will respond when it detects malicious data.
Recommendation - Choose the option 'Die With Message'.

sections.title: Whitelists - IPs, Pages, Parameters, and Users that bypass the Firewall
summary: In principle you should not need to whitelist anything or anyone unless you have discovered a collision with another plugin.
Recommendation - Do not whitelist anything unless you are confident in what you are doing.

sections.title: Enable Module: Firewall
summary: Purpose - The Firewall is designed to analyse data sent to your website and block any requests that appear to be malicious.
Recommendation - Keep the Firewall feature turned on.

sections.title: File Guard
summary: Purpose - Monitor WordPress files and protect against malicious intrusion and hacking.
Recommendation - Keep the File Guard features turned on.

sections.title: Vulnerability Scanner
summary: Purpose - Regularly scan your WordPress plugins and themes for known security vulnerabilities.
Recommendation - Ensure this is turned on and you will always know if any of your assets have known security vulnerabilities.

sections.title: Scan Options
summary: Purpose - Set how often the Hack Guard scans will run.

sections.title: Enable Module: Hack Guard
summary: Purpose - Hack Guard is a set of tools to warn you and protect you against hacks on your site.
Recommendation - Keep the Hack Guard module turned on.

sections.title: Advanced Security Headers
summary: Purpose - Protect visitors to your site by implementing increased security response headers.
Recommendation - Enabling these features are advised, but you must test them on your site thoroughly.

sections.title: Content Security Policy
summary: Purpose - Restrict the sources and types of content that may be loaded and processed by visitor browsers.
Recommendation - Enabling these features are advised, but you must test them on your site thoroughly.

sections.title: Enable Module: HTTP Headers
summary: Purpose - Protect visitors to your site by implementing increased security response headers.
Recommendation - Enabling these features are advised, but you must test them on your site thoroughly.

sections.title: Automatic IP Black List
summary: Purpose - The Automatic IP Black List system will block the IP addresses of naughty visitors after a specified number of transgressions.
Recommendation - Keep the Automatic IP Black List feature turned on.

sections.title: Identify Common Bot Behaviours
summary: Recommendation - Enable to capture bots/spiders that don't honour 'nofollow' directives.

sections.title: Customize Messages Shown To User
summary: Purpose - Customize the messages shown to visitors.
Recommendation - Be sure to change the messages to suit your audience.
Hint - To reset any message to its default, enter the text exactly: default

sections.title: Enable Module: IP Manager
summary: Purpose - The IP Manager allows you to whitelist, blacklist and configure auto-blacklist rules.
Recommendation - Keep the IP Manager feature turned on. You should also carefully review the automatic black list settings.

sections.title: WordPress System Lockdown
summary: Purpose - Lockdown certain core WordPress system features.
Recommendation - This depends on your usage and needs for certain WordPress functions and features.

sections.title: Permissions and Access Options
summary: Purpose - Provides finer control of certain WordPress permissions.
Recommendation - Only enable SSL if you have a valid certificate installed.

sections.title: WordPress Obscurity Options
summary: Purpose - Obscures certain WordPress settings from public view.
Recommendation - Obscurity is not true security and so these settings are down to your personal tastes.

sections.title: Enable Module: Lockdown
summary: Purpose - Lockdown helps secure-up certain loosely-controlled WordPress settings on your site.
Recommendation - Keep the Lockdown feature turned on.

sections.title: Brute Force Login Guard
summary: Purpose - Blocks brute force hacking attacks against your login and registration pages.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
summary: Purpose - Verifies the identity of users who log in to your site - i.e. they are who they say they are.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend. However, if your host blocks email sending you may lock yourself out.
Note: You may combine multiple authentication factors for increased security.

sections.title: Email Two-Factor Authentication
summary: Purpose - Verifies the identity of users who log in to your site using email-based one-time-passwords.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend. However, if your host blocks email sending you may lock yourself out.
Note: You may combine multiple authentication factors for increased security.

sections.title: One-Time Passwords
summary: Purpose - Verifies the identity of users who log in to your site using Google Authenticator one-time-passwords.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend. However, if your host blocks email sending you may lock yourself out.
Note: You may combine multiple authentication factors for increased security.

sections.title: Hardware 2-Factor Authentication
summary: Purpose - Verifies the identity of users who log in to your site using Yubikey one-time-passwords.
Note: You may combine multiple authentication factors for increased security.

sections.title: Hide WP Login Page
summary: Purpose - To hide your wp-login.php page from brute force attacks and hacking attempts - if your login page cannot be found, no-one can login.
Recommendation - This is not required for complete security and if your site has irregular or inconsistent configuration it may not work for you.

sections.title: Disable Login Guard Module
summary: Purpose - Login Guard blocks all automated and brute force attempts to log in to your site.
Recommendation - Keep the Login Guard module turned on.

sections.title: Deprecated
summary: These options will be removed in the future. Please use the ADE option under Bot SPAM section.

sections.title: Traffic Log Options
summary: Purpose - Provides finer control over the live traffic system.
Recommendation - These settings are dependent on your requirements.

sections.title: Traffic Rate Limiting
summary: Purpose - Provides ability to restrict excessive requests from a single visitor.
Recommendation - These settings are dependent on your requirements.

sections.title: Enable Module: Traffic Log
summary: Purpose - The Traffic Log module lets you monitor and review all requests to your site.
Recommendation - Required only if you need to review and investigate and monitor requests to your site.

sections.title: User Session Management
summary: Purpose - Allows you to better control user sessions on your site and expire idle sessions and prevent account sharing.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Password Policies
summary: Purpose - Have full control over passwords used by users on the site.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: User Registration
summary: Purpose - Control user registration and prevent SPAM.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Automatic And Manual User Suspension
summary: Purpose - Automatically suspend accounts to prevent login by certain users.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Admin Login Notification
summary: Purpose - So you can be made aware of when a WordPress administrator has logged into your site when you are not expecting it.
Recommendation - Use of this feature is highly recommend.

sections.title: Enable Module: User Management
summary: Purpose - User Management offers real user sessions, finer control over user session time-out, and ensures users have logged-in in a correct manner.
Recommendation - Keep the User Management feature turned on.

options.name: Enable Security Admin
options.summary: Enforce Security Admin Access Restriction
options.description: Enable this with great care and consideration. When this Access PIN option is enabled, you must specify a key below and use it to gain access to this plugin.

options.name: Security Admin Access PIN
options.summary: Provide/Update Security Admin Access PIN
options.description: Careful: If you forget this, you could potentially lock yourself out from using this plugin.

options.name: Security Admins
options.summary: Persistent Security Admins
options.description: All emails, usernames, or user IDs entered here will always be Security Admins.

options.name: Security Admin Timeout
options.summary: Specify An Automatic Timeout Interval For Security Admin Access
options.description: This will automatically expire your Security Admin Session. Does not apply until you enter the access PIN again. Default: 60 minutes.

options.name: Allow Email Override
options.summary: Allow Email Override Of Admin Access Restrictions
options.description: Allow the use of verification emails to override and switch off the Security Admin restrictions.

options.name: Run In MU Mode
options.summary: Run Plugin In Must-Use (MU) Mode
options.description: Setup the plugin to run as an MU-plugin to prevent accidental deactivation.

options.name: WordPress Options
options.summary: Restrict Access To Certain WordPress Admin Options
options.description: Careful: This will restrict the ability of WordPress administrators from changing key WordPress settings.

options.name: Admin Users
options.summary: Restrict Access To Create/Delete/Modify Other Admin Users
options.description: Careful: This will restrict the ability of WordPress administrators from creating, modifying or promoting other administrators.

options.summary: Restrict Access To Key WordPress Plugin Actions
options.description: Careful: This will restrict access to plugin installation, update, activation and deletion. Note: Selecting 'Activate' will also restrict all other options.

options.summary: Restrict Access To WordPress Theme Actions
options.description: Careful: This will restrict access to theme installation, update, activation and deletion.

options.summary: Restrict Access To Key WordPress Posts And Pages Actions
options.description: Careful: This will restrict access to page/post creation, editing and deletion.

options.name: Enable White Label
options.summary: Activate Your White Label Settings
options.description: Use this option to turn on/off the whole White Label feature.

options.name: Hide Updates
options.summary: Hide Available Updates From Non Security Admins
options.description: Hides the availability of Shield updates from non-security admins.

options.name: Replace Plugin Badge
options.summary: Replace Plugin Badge URL and Images
options.description: When using the plugin badge, replace the URL and link with your Whitelabel settings.

options.name: Plugin Name
options.summary: The Name Of The Plugin
options.description: The Name Of The Plugin.

options.name: Menu Title
options.summary: The Main Menu Title Of The Plugin
options.description: The Main Menu Title Of The Plugin. If left empty, the Plugin Name will be used.

options.name: Company Name
options.summary: The Name Of Your Company
options.description: Provide the name of your company.

options.default: Secure Your Sites With The World's Most Powerful WordPress Security Plugin
options.name: Plugin Tag Line
options.summary: The Tag Line Of The Plugin
options.description: The Tag Line Of The Plugin.

options.name: Home URL
options.summary: Plugin Home Page URL
options.description: When a user clicks the home link for this plugin, this is where they'll be directed.

options.name: Menu Icon
options.summary: Menu Icon URL
options.description: The URL of the icon displayed in the menu.

options.name: Plugin Badge Logo
options.summary: Plugin Badge Logo URL
options.description: The URL of the logo displayed in the main dashboard. Should be 128x128px

options.name: Dashboard and 2FA Logo
options.summary: Dashboard and 2FA Logo URL
options.description: The URL of the logo displayed in the main dashboard. Should be 128x128px

options.name: Enable Activity Log
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Activity Log module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Activity Log module

options.name: Logging Level
options.summary: Logging Level For DB-Based Logs
options.description: Logging Level For DB-Based Logs

options.name: Auto Clean
options.summary: Enable Audit Auto Cleaning
options.description: Events older than the number of days specified will be automatically cleaned from the database

options.name: File Logging Level
options.summary: Logging Level For File-Based Logs
options.description: Logging Level For File-Based Logs

options.name: Enable Automatic Updates
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Automatic Updates module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Automatic Updates module

options.name: Disable All
options.summary: Completely Disable WordPress Automatic Updates
options.description: When selected, regardless of any other settings, all WordPress automatic updates on this site will be completely disabled!

options.name: WordPress Core Updates
options.summary: Decide how the WordPress Core will automatically update, if at all
options.description: At least automatically upgrading minor versions is recommended (and is the WordPress default).

options.name: Plugins
options.summary: Automatically Update Plugins
options.description: Note: Automatic updates for plugins are disabled on WordPress by default.

options.name: Themes
options.summary: Automatically Update Themes
options.description: Note: Automatic updates for themes are disabled on WordPress by default.

options.name: Update Delay
options.summary: Delay Automatic Updates For Period Of Stability
options.description: Shield will delay upgrades until the new update has been available for the set number of days.

options.name: Auto Update Plugin
options.summary: Always Automatically Update This Plugin
options.description: Regardless of any other settings, automatically update the Shield plugin.

options.name: Send Report Email
options.summary: Send email notices after automatic updates
options.description: You can turn on/off email notices from automatic updates by un/checking this box.

options.name: Report Email Address
options.summary: Where to send upgrade notification reports
options.description: If this is empty, it will default to the Site Admin email address

options.name: Enable SPAM Protection
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Comments SPAM Protection module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Comments SPAM Protection module

options.name: Trusted Commenter Minimum
options.summary: Minimum Number Of Approved Comments Before Commenter Is Trusted
options.description: Specify how many approved comments must exist before a commenter is trusted and their comments are no longer scanned.

options.name: Trusted Users
options.summary: Don't Scan Comments For Users With The Following Roles
options.description: Shield doesn't normally scan comments from logged-in or registered users. Specify user roles here that shouldn't be scanned.

options.name: AntiBot Detection Technology
options.summary: Use Shield's Unique AntiBot Detection Technology
options.description: Use Shield's AntiBot Detection Engine To Detect and Block SPAM Bots.

options.name: SPAM Action
options.summary: How To Categorise Comments When Identified To Be SPAM
options.description: When a comment is detected as being SPAM from an automatic bot, the comment will be categorised based on this setting.

options.name: Human SPAM Filter
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Human SPAM Filter module
options.description: Scans the content of WordPress comments for keywords that are indicative of SPAM and marks the comment according to your preferred setting below.

options.name: Comments Cooldown
options.summary: Minimum Time Interval Between Comments
options.description: Prevents comment floods and ensure a minimum period before any further comments are accepted on the site.

options.name: SPAM Action
options.summary: How To Categorise Comments When Identified To Be SPAM'
options.description: When a comment is detected as being SPAM from a human commenter, the comment will be categorised based on this setting.

options.name: Enable Firewall
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Firewall module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Firewall module

options.name: Directory Traversals
options.summary: Block Directory Traversals
options.description: This will block directory traversal paths in in application parameters.

options.name: SQL Queries
options.summary: Block SQL Queries
options.description: This will block SQL in application parameters.

options.name: WordPress Terms
options.summary: Block WordPress Specific Terms
options.description: This will block WordPress specific terms in application parameters (wp_, user_login, etc.).

options.name: Field Truncation
options.summary: Block Field Truncation Attacks
options.description: This will block field truncation attacks in application parameters

options.name: PHP Code
options.summary: Block PHP Code Includes
options.description: This will block any data that appears to try and include PHP files. Will probably block saving within the Plugin/Theme file editors.

options.name: Exe File Uploads
options.summary: Block Executable File Uploads
options.description: This will block executable file uploads (.php, .exe, etc.).

options.name: Aggressive Scan
options.summary: Aggressively Block Data
options.description: Employs a set of aggressive rules to detect and block malicious data submitted to your site. Warning - May cause an increase in false-positive firewall blocks.

options.name: Block Response
options.summary: How the firewall responds when it blocks a request
options.description: We recommend dying with a message so you know what might have occurred when the firewall blocks you.

options.name: Send Email Report
options.summary: When a visitor is blocked the firewall will send an email to the configured email address
options.description: Use with caution - if you get hit by automated bots you may send out too many emails and you could get blocked by your host.

options.name: Whitelist Parameters
options.summary: Detail pages and parameters that are whitelisted (ignored by the firewall)
options.description: This should be used with caution and you should only provide parameter names that you must have excluded

options.name: Ignore Administrators
options.summary: Ignore Administrators
options.description: Authenticated administrator users will not be processed by the firewall rules.

options.name: Enable Hack Guard
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Hack Guard Module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Hack Guard module

options.name: WP Core File Scanner
options.summary: Automatically Scans WordPress Core Files For Alterations
options.description: Compares all WordPress core files on your site against the official WordPress files. WordPress Core files should never be altered for any reason.

options.name: File Scan Areas
options.summary: Which Files Should Be Scanned
options.description: Specific file scan areas.

options.name: Auto File Repair
options.summary: Which Files Should Be Automatically Repaired?
options.description: When a file is modified, or malware is detected, Shield can try to repair files.

options.name: File Locker
options.summary: Lock Files Against Tampering and Changes
options.description: As soon as changes are detected to any selected files, the contents may be examined and reverted.

options.name: Scan Exclusions
options.summary: Scan File and Folder Exclusions
options.description: Scan File and Folder Exclusions.

options.name: Abandoned Plugin Scanner
options.summary: Enable The Abandoned Plugin Scanner
options.description: Scan your WordPress.org assets for whether they've been abandoned.

options.name: Vulnerability Scanner
options.summary: Enable The Vulnerability Scanner
options.description: Scan all your WordPress assets for known security vulnerabilities.

options.name: Automatic Updates
options.summary: Apply Updates Automatically To Vulnerable Plugins
options.description: When an update becomes available, automatically apply updates to items with known vulnerabilities.

options.name: Optimise File Scans
options.summary: Optimise File Scans
options.description: Optimise file scans wherever possible.

options.name: Scan Frequency
options.summary: Number Of Times To Automatically Scan Core Files In 24 Hours
options.description: Default: Once every 24hrs. To improve security, increase the number of scans per day.

options.name: Show Re-Install Links
options.summary: Show Re-Install Links For Plugins
options.description: Show links to re-install plugins and offer re-install when activating plugins.

options.name: Enable HTTP Headers
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The HTTP Headers module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the HTTP Headers module

value_options.text: On: Allow iFrames On The Same Domain

options.name: Block iFrames
options.summary: Block Remote iFrames Of This Site
options.description: The setting prevents any external website from embedding your site in an iFrame. This is useful for preventing so-called ClickJack attacks.

options.name: XSS Protection
options.summary: Employ Built-In Browser XSS Protection
options.description: Directs compatible browsers to block what they detect as Reflective XSS attacks.

options.name: Prevent Mime-Sniff
options.summary: Turn-Off Browser Mime-Sniff
options.description: Reduces visitor exposure to malicious user-uploaded content.

options.name: Referrer Policy
options.summary: Referrer Policy Header
options.description: The Referrer Policy Header allows you to control when and what referral information a browser may pass along with links clicked on your site.

options.name: Enable Content Security Policy
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Content Security Policy module
options.description: Allows for permission and restriction of all resources loaded on your site.

options.name: Manual Rules
options.summary: Manual CSP Rules
options.description: Manual CSP rules.

options.name: Enable MainWP
options.summary: Enable The Built-In MainWP Extension
options.description: This option will enable Shield's built-in MainWP extension for both server and client.

options.name: SureSend Emails
options.summary: SureSend Emails
options.description: SureSend Emails.

options.name: Form SPAM Checking
options.summary: Select The Form Providers That Should Be Checked For SPAM
options.description: Select The Form Providers That Should Be Checked For SPAM.

options.name: User Form Checking
options.summary: Select The User Form Providers That Should Be Checked For SPAM Registrations and Logins
options.description: Select The User Form Providers That Should Be Checked For SPAM Registrations and Logins

options.name: Enable IP Manager
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The IP Manager module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the IP Manager module

options.name: Bot Challenge Complexity
options.summary: Bot Challenge Complexity
options.description: Bot Challenge Complexity

options.name: AntiBot Threshold
options.summary: AntiBot Testing Threshold (Percentage)
options.description: When using Shield's AntiBot system, this is the threshold used for testing (between 1 and 99).

options.name: High Reputation Bypass
options.summary: Prevent IPs/Visitors With High Reputation Scores From Being Blocked
options.description: Ensures that visitors with a high reputation are never blocked by Shield.

options.name: Offense Limit
options.summary: Visitor IP address will be Black Listed after X bad actions on your site
options.description: A black mark is set against an IP address each time a visitor trips the defenses of the Shield plugin. When the number of these offenses exceeds specified limit, they are automatically blocked from accessing the site. Set this to 0 to turn off the Automatic IP Black List feature.

options.name: Auto Block Expiration
options.summary: After 1 'X' a black listed IP will be removed from the black list
options.description: Permanent and lengthy IP Black Lists are harmful to performance. You should allow IP addresses on the black list to be eventually removed over time. Shorter IP black lists are more efficient and a more intelligent use of an IP-based blocking system.

value_options.text: Magic Email Links To Unblock Logged-In Users

options.name: User Auto Unblock
options.summary: Allow Visitors To Unblock Their IP
options.description: Allow visitors blocked by the plugin to automatically unblock themselves.

options.name: Request Path Whitelist
options.summary: Request Path Whitelist
options.description: Request Path Whitelist.

value_options.text: Block Request With Ability To Auto-Unblock

options.name: CrowdSec IP Blocking
options.summary: How To Handle Requests From IPs Found On CrowdSec Blocklist
options.description: How should Shield block requests from IP address that are found on CrowdSec's list of malicious IP addresses.

options.name: Enroll ID
options.summary: CrowdSec Enroll ID
options.description: CrowdSec Enroll ID.

options.name: Failed Login
options.summary: Detect Failed Login Attempts By Valid Usernames
options.description: Penalise a visitor who fails to login using a valid username.

options.name: XML-RPC Access
options.summary: Identify A Bot When It Accesses XML-RPC
options.description: If you don't use XML-RPC, why would anyone access it?

options.name: Invalid Usernames
options.summary: Detect Invalid Username Logins
options.description: Identify A Bot When It Tries To Login With A Non-Existent Username.

options.name: Fake Web Crawler
options.summary: Detect Fake Search Engine Crawlers
options.description: Identify a Bot when it presents as an official web crawler, but analysis shows it's fake.

options.name: 404 Detect
options.summary: Identify A Bot When It Hits A 404
options.description: Detect When A Visitor Browses To A Non-Existent Page.

options.name: Link Cheese
options.summary: Tempt A Bot With A Fake Link To Follow
options.description: Detect A Bot That Follows A 'no-follow' Link.

options.name: Invalid Script Load
options.summary: Identify A Bot Attempts To Load WordPress In A Non-Standard Way
options.description: WordPress should only be loaded in a limited number of ways.

options.name: Empty User Agents
options.summary: Detect Requests With Empty User Agents
options.description: Identify a request as a bot if the user agent is not provided.

options.name: Enable Lockdown
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Lockdown module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Lockdown module

options.name: Disable XML-RPC
options.summary: Disable The XML-RPC System
options.description: Checking this option will completely turn off the whole XML-RPC system.

options.name: Anonymous Rest API
options.summary: Disable The Anonymous Rest API
options.description: Checking this option will completely turn off the whole Anonymous Rest API system.

options.name: Rest API Exclusions
options.summary: Anonymous REST API Exclusions
options.description: Any namespaces provided here will be excluded from the Anonymous API restriction.

options.name: Disable File Editing
options.summary: Disable Ability To Edit Files From Within WordPress
options.description: Removes the option to directly edit any files from within the WordPress admin area. Equivalent to setting 'DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT' to TRUE.

options.name: Force SSL Admin
options.summary: Forces WordPress Admin Dashboard To Be Delivered Over SSL
options.description: Please only enable this option if you have a valid SSL certificate installed. Equivalent to setting 'FORCE_SSL_ADMIN' to TRUE.

options.name: Block Username Fishing
options.summary: Block the ability to discover WordPress usernames based on author IDs
options.description: When enabled, any URL requests containing 'author=' will be killed. Warning: Enabling this option may interfere with expected operations of your site.

options.name: Clean WP Files
options.summary: Automatically Delete Unnecessary WP Files
options.description: Automatically delete WordPress files like wp-config-sample.php.

options.name: WP Generator Tag
options.summary: Remove WP Generator Meta Tag
options.description: Remove a meta tag from your WordPress pages that publicly displays that your site is WordPress and its current version.

options.name: Enable Login Guard
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Login Guard Module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Login Guard module

options.name: Hide WP Login & Admin
options.summary: Hide The WordPress Login And Admin Areas
options.description: Creating a path here will disable your 'wp-login.php'. Only letters and numbers are permitted: abc123

options.name: WP Login & Admin Redirect
options.summary: Automatic Redirect URL For Hidden Pages
options.description: Automatically redirect requests to this location for the hidden pages.

options.name: MFA Verification Page
options.summary: Type Of MFA Verification Page
options.description: Choose the page type for MFA verification

options.name: User 2FA Setup
options.summary: User 2FA Setup Page Locations
options.description: Pages available to users to configure 2FA.

options.name: 2FA Remember Me
options.summary: A User Can Bypass Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) For The Set Number Of Days
options.description: Enter the number of days a user can bypass future MFA after a successful MFA-login. 0 to disable.

options.name: Allow Backup Codes
options.summary: Allow Users To Generate A Backup Code
options.description: Allow users to generate a backup code that can be used to login if MFA factors are unavailable.

options.name: Enable Google Authenticator
options.summary: Allow Users To Use Google Authenticator
options.description: When enabled, users will have the option to add Google Authenticator to their WordPress user profile.

options.name: Allow Yubikey OTP
options.summary: Allow Yubikey Registration For One Time Passwords
options.description: Combined with your Yubikey API Key (below) this will form the basis of your Yubikey Authentication.

options.name: Yubikey App ID
options.summary: Your Unique Yubikey App ID
options.description: Combined with your Yubikey API Key this will form the basis of your Yubikey Authentication.

options.name: Yubikey API Key
options.summary: Your Unique Yubikey App API Key
options.description: Combined with your Yubikey App ID this will form the basis of your Yubikey Authentication.

options.name: Enable Email Authentication
options.summary: Two-Factor Login Authentication By Email
options.description: All users will be required to verify their login by email-based two-factor authentication.

options.name: Email Auto-Login
options.summary: Enable Email Auto-Login Links
options.description: 2FA Email will contain an auto-login link so the user doesn't need to enter 2FA code manually.

options.name: Enforce - Email Authentication
options.summary: All User Roles Subject To Email Authentication
options.description: Enforces email-based authentication on all users with the selected roles. Note: This setting only applies to email authentication.

options.name: Allow Any User
options.summary: Allow Any User To Turn-On Two-Factor Authentication By Email
options.description: Allow Any User To Turn-On Two-Factor Authentication By Email.

options.name: AntiBot
options.summary: Use AntiBot Detection Engine
options.description: Use Shield's AntiBot Detection Engine To Block Bots and Brute Force Attacks

options.name: Protection Locations
options.summary: How Google reCAPTCHA Will Be Displayed
options.description: Choose for which forms bot protection measures will be deployed.

options.name: Login Cooldown Interval
options.summary: Limit login attempts to every X seconds
options.description: WordPress will process only ONE login attempt for every number of seconds specified. Zero (0) turns this off.

options.name: Bot Protection
options.summary: Protect WP Login From Automated Login Attempts By Bots
options.description: Adds a dynamically (Javascript) generated checkbox to the login form that prevents bots using automated login techniques. Recommended: ON.

options.name: AntiBot Forms
options.summary: Enter The IDs Of The 3rd Party Login Forms For Use With AntiBot JS
options.description: For Use With AnitBot JS (above).

options.name: Enable Passkeys
options.summary: Allow Registration Of Passkeys
options.description: Allow Registration Of Passkeys.

options.name: GASP Checkbox Text
options.summary: The Message Displayed Next To The GASP Checkbox
options.description: You can change the text displayed to the user beside the checkbox if you need a customized message.

options.default: Please check the box to show us you're a human.
options.name: GASP Alert Text
options.summary: The Message Displayed If The User Doesn't Check The Box
options.description: You can change the text displayed to the user in the alert message if they don't check the box.

options.name: Enable/Disable All Plugin Modules
options.summary: Global Plugin On/Off Switch
options.description: Uncheck this option to disable all Shield features

options.name: Visitor IP Address
options.summary: Which Address Is Yours
options.description: There are many way to detect visitor IP addresses. Please select yours from the list.

options.name: Report Email
options.summary: Where to send all email reports and admin notifications for the plugin
options.description: If this is empty, it will default to the blog admin email address.

options.name: Enable Information Gathering
options.summary: Permit Anonymous Usage Information Gathering
options.description: Allows us to gather information on statistics and features in-use across our client installations. This information is strictly anonymous and contains no personally, or otherwise, identifiable data.

options.name: Enable ShieldNET
options.summary: Enhanced Website Security Through Network Intelligence
options.description: Enhanced Website Security Through Network Intelligence.

options.name: In-Plugin Notices
options.summary: Display Plugin Specific Notices
options.description: Disable this option to hide certain plugin admin notices about available updates and post-update notices.

options.name: Allow WP-CLI
options.summary: Allow Access And Control Of This Plugin Via WP-CLI
options.description: Turn off this option to disable this plugin's WP-CLI integration.

options.name: Show Plugin Badge
options.summary: Display Plugin Security Badge On Your Site
options.description: Enabling this option helps support the plugin by spreading the word about it on your website. The plugin badge also demonstrates to visitors that you take your website security seriously.

options.name: Delete Plugin Settings
options.summary: Delete All Plugin Settings Upon Plugin Deactivation
options.description: Careful: Removes all plugin options when you deactivate the plugin.

options.name: Temp Dir
options.summary: Preferred Temporary Directory
options.description: Preferred temporary directory override.

options.name: Locale Override
options.summary: Delete All Plugin Settings Upon Plugin Deactivation
options.description: Careful: Removes all plugin options when you deactivate the plugin.

options.name: Beta Access
options.summary: Enable Access To Beta Versions
options.description: Enable This Option To Allow Shield To Upgrade To Beta and Pre-Release Versions

options.name: Allow Import/Export
options.summary: Allow Import Of Options To, And Export Of Options From, This Site
options.description: Uncheck this box to completely disable import and export of options.

options.name: Auto-Import URL
options.summary: Automatically Import Options From This Site
options.description: Supplying a valid site URL here will make this site an 'Options Slave' and will automatically import options daily.

options.name: Export Whitelist
options.summary: Whitelisted Sites Which Do Not Need The Secret Key To Export Options
options.description: Each site on this list will be able to export options from this site without providing the secret key. Take a new line for each URL.

options.name: Notify Whitelist
options.summary: Notify Sites On The Whitelist To Update Options From Master
options.description: When enabled, manual options saving will notify sites on the whitelist to export options from the Master site.

options.name: Secret Key
options.summary: Import/Export Secret Key
options.description: Keep this Secret Key private as it will allow the import and export of options.

options.name: Alert Reports Frequency
options.summary: How Often Should You Be Sent Reports With Important Alerts
options.description: Decide when you should be sent reports with alerts about your site security.

options.name: Info Reports Frequency
options.summary: How Often Should You Be Sent Information Reports
options.description: Decide when you should be sent non-critical information and reports about your site security.

options.name: Shield Deactivated
options.summary: Be alerted when the Shield plugin is deactivated
options.description: Be alerted when the Shield plugin is deactivated.

options.name: Admin Accounts
options.summary: Be alerted to any important change on any admin account
options.description: Be alerted to any important change on any admin account.

options.name: Vulnerabilities
options.summary: Be alerted to discovery of any vulnerable plugin/theme
options.description: Be alerted to discovery of any vulnerable plugin/theme.

options.name: FileLocker Changes
options.summary: Be alerted to any changes to FileLocker items
options.description: Be alerted to any changes to FileLocker items.

options.name: Enable Traffic Log
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The Traffic Log Module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the Traffic Log module.

options.name: Enable Traffic Logger
options.summary: Turn On The Traffic Logging Feature
options.description: Enable or disable the ability to log and monitor requests to your site.

options.name: Live Logging
options.summary: Enable Live Logging Of All Traffic
options.description: Switch-on logging of all site traffic.

options.name: Traffic Log Exclusions
options.summary: Select Which Types Of Requests To Exclude
options.description: Deselect any requests that you don't want to appear in the traffic viewer.

options.name: Custom Exclusions
options.summary: Provide Custom Traffic Exclusions
options.description: For each entry, if the text is present in either the User Agent or Page/Path, it will be excluded.

options.name: Log Retention
options.summary: Enable Traffic Log Auto Expiry
options.description: Automated DB cleanup will delete logs older than this maximum value (in days).

options.name: Enable Rate Limiting
options.summary: Turn On The Rate Limiting Feature
options.description: Enable or disable the rate limiting feature according to your rate limiting parameters.

options.name: Max Request Limit
options.summary: Maximum Number Of Requests Allowed In Time Limit
options.description: The maximum number of requests that are allowed in the given time limit.

options.name: Request Limit Time Interval
options.summary: The Time Interval To Test For Excessive Requests
options.description: The time limit within which to monitor for excessive requests that exceed the limit.

options.name: Enable User Management
options.summary: Enable (or Disable) The User Management module
options.description: Un-Checking this option will completely disable the User Management module

options.name: User Login Notification Email
options.summary: Send Email Notification To Each User Upon Successful Login
options.description: A notification is sent to each user when a successful login occurs for their account.

options.name: Admin Login Notification Email
options.summary: Send An Notification Email When Administrator Logs In
options.description: If you would like to be notified every time an administrator user logs into this WordPress site, enter a notification email address. No email address - No Notification.

options.name: Session Timeout
options.summary: Specify How Many Days After Login To Automatically Force Re-Login
options.description: WordPress default is 2 days, or 14 days if you check the 'Remember Me' box.

options.name: Idle Timeout
options.summary: Specify How Many Hours After Inactivity To Automatically Logout User
options.description: If the user is inactive for the number of hours specified, they will be forcefully logged out next time they return. Set this to '0' to turn off this option.

options.name: Session Lock
options.summary: Lock User Sessions To

options.name: Validate Email Addresses
options.summary: Validate Email Addresses When User Attempts To Register
options.description: Validate Email Addresses When User Attempts To Register.

options.name: Email Checks
options.summary: The Email Address Properties That Will Be Tested

options.name: Enable Password Policies
options.summary: Enable The Password Policies Below
options.description: Turn on/off all password policies.

options.name: Prevent Pwned Passwords
options.summary: Prevent Use Of Pwned Passwords
options.description: Prevents users from using any passwords found on the public available list of pwned passwords.

options.name: Minimum Strength
options.summary: Minimum Password Strength
options.description: All passwords that a user sets must meet this minimum strength.

options.name: Password Expiration
options.summary: Passwords Expire After This Many Days
options.description: Users will be forced to reset their passwords after the number of days specified.

options.name: Apply To Existing Users
options.summary: Apply Password Policies To Existing Users and Their Passwords
options.description: Forces existing users to update their passwords if they don't meet requirements, after they next login .

options.name: Allow Manual User Suspension
options.summary: Manually Suspend User Accounts To Prevent Login
options.description: Users may be suspended by administrators to prevent login.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Expired Passwords
options.summary: Automatically Suspend Users With Expired Passwords
options.description: Suspend login by users and require password reset to unsuspend.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Idle Users
options.summary: Automatically Suspend Idle User Accounts
options.description: Prevent login by idle users and require password reset to unsuspend.

options.name: Auto-Suspend Idle Users
options.summary: Automatically Suspend Idle User Accounts
options.description: Prevent login by idle users and require password reset to unsuspend.

type.comment: The type of file being locked

last_unblock_attempt_at.comment: Last Time An Auto-Unblock Attempt Was Made

expires_at.comment: The IP Rule on this lists expires at this time.

imported_at.comment: This IP rule was imported from a master site.

file_path.comment: The relative path of the malware-containing file.

sig.comment: The malware signature pattern that triggered the discovery

malai_status.comment: The status of the file from malai

last_malai_status_at.comment: Last Check With Malai For Status

ri_ref.comment: Reference to primary Result Item record

can_export.comment: Can rule be included in site-to-site export
